website_summaries.verdict: An affordable broad-spectrum dog dewormer that your dog will eat without complaint.
pros: Suitable for dogs as young as 6 weeks
Treats tapeworms, roundworms, hookworms and whipworms
Easy to mix in with dog's food
3 different dosages for small, medium and large dogs
cons: Some users have said that the dosage for large dogs isn't strong enough

customer_reviews.title: Cancer Preventative!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a cancer preventative after hearing Joe Tippens cancer testimony. What blew me away was the information I subsequently read about parasitic worms causing cancer in people and animals!! The medical community knows this and never talks about it. Google “cancer causing parasitic worms”. This dewormer is the best anti-cancer medicine in the world and the FDA doesn’t talk about it. Criminals.
customer_reviews.author: kathy frazier

customer_reviews.title: Effective money saving treatment!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! Works like a charm. Saves an expensive trip to the vet. Both tapeworms and roundworms are visible in their excrement and have a very distinctive look. The vet when I went there wanted me to pay for all these labs to see what kind of worms they were. I said I know what tapeworms looks like. Yet the test was still required. And guess what, it was tapeworms! When he came down with them again the next year, I skipped the trip to the vet and bought this. Worked just as well and saved a ton of money!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Meyers

customer_reviews.title: who recommended praziquantel and it was successful the first time
customer_reviews.text: I gave my dog this SafeGuard dewormer 4 times and it was not effective for tapeworms, despite its labeling. So I asked my vet, who recommended praziquantel and it was successful the first time. Bayer has one you can buy here:
customer_reviews.author: momlady

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: I adopted Musa from the county shelter about 2 weeks ago and she started developing a rash on her stomach that got very bad in only 2 days (1st picture). I found tapeworm on her poop and decided to buy this product (even though I was not sure because of the price). It exceeded all my expectations. After the first use her stomach got so much better (2nd picture) and then after the 3 days treatment it was almost completely clear (3rd picture). I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Rocio

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Worked wonders, my 9 year old American Cocker Spaniel is now worm free! She has never hard worms before, but she recently had to have her spleen removed, and no later than 2 weeks post surgery, I noticed worms in her poop. After paying over $3000 for her surgery, the monthly budget was getting sort of tight, so I searched the internet and saw the great reviews on this product, and I am so happy that I ordered it. My girl is worm free and back to her old self.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Lo

customer_reviews.title: Beware, more than one pack necessay to treat a dog.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the package marked for large breeds. It comes with three pouches of 4 grams, which according to the directions it would not be enough to treat my 75 pound yellow lab. I need to buy an extra pack to give him the necessary treatment. Nowhere in the product description does it say that you need to buy more than one pack for treating the indicated size dog. I could've bought a one pill treatment for my dog at any pet store for less than the price I'm going to have to pay for the two packs necessary for treating my dog with Safe-Guard 4. A total reap off!
customer_reviews.author: F. Mercado

customer_reviews.title: Made my puppy throw up
customer_reviews.text: My two dogs showed signs of worms (scooting) so I gave them this dewormer. One seemed okay-ish. The other is currently has been vomiting all day, super lethargic, not interested in eating. This was day 4 and we finished the 3 day treatment 27 hours ago. If he continues like this, we will be going to the vet tomorrow. He’s a 10 month old super rambunctious and healthy puppy. So upset about this right now. Should be noted, there is a precaution on the box that claims only 1% of dogs have a vomiting reaction to the dewormer. I don’t believe that to be totally honest.
customer_reviews.author: bkjn06

customer_reviews.title: The only real remedy for Giardia......
customer_reviews.text: Febendazole is the only remedy for Giardia that I have found through the years. Giardia can be tough to get rid of in puppies, especially the ones from the shelter kennels but this has worked for me every time. The directions are easy enough to read and follow and if done as requested, will indeed, get rid of worms, etc. I have met so many people who have had trouble with Giardia related issues only to be given the incorrect info from the veterinarian. The veterinarians should know better and it makes you wonder what their agenda really is....think on that. This product works perfectly for me and has kept my puppy parasite free. Thank you !
customer_reviews.author: ~Galactic Hat~

customer_reviews.title: Diarrhea for daaays
customer_reviews.text: Definitely NOT recommended. Not sure why but I totally missed out on the fact that this specific kind is the powder kind you have to give you dogs for 3 days. It’s insanely messy AND gave both my large dogs the mad runs. (No, they did not have worms or anything. Very healthy and active dogs.) & truth is, I the package suggested I give them more than what I did for their weight. Sure glad I didn’t. They’ve never had an issue with mad explosions, but something in this did not work well with their systems. So just a word of caution — do not use if your dogs have sensitive stomachs!
customer_reviews.author: chantel

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, dogs won't touch this.
customer_reviews.text: Dog wouldn't go near his food after tainting it with dewormer. The problem is that there is soooo much powder that you can't just put it on a small amount of food as the instructions say. There is so much powder that even a normal amount of food is too little to cut the powder. I bought Naturpet D wormer liquid at the same time, thankfully, and was able to dose him easily with it, and it got rid of the worms without a pesticide.
customer_reviews.author: G. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Made my pets very SICK!
customer_reviews.text: I made sure the dosage was correct and gave this to my dogs. They were throwing up all night long. I thought it may just be a side effect and two weeks later gave them a second does but cut it in half. They reacted the same. FYI- my pets are super healthy and did not have signs of worms. I had given them this de wormer as a preventive care treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Travis S.

customer_reviews.title: So happy my 100lb baby bear/akita Nikita got rid of those ...
customer_reviews.text: OMG THIS WORKS!!! So happy my 100lb baby bear/akita Nikita got rid of those nasty things! One big clump of white stuff came out. I'm in South Carolina so she's been getting some fleas and she most likely hunts them and swallows, so I'm now super careful where we go walk outside and I've fixed the flea problem and with the SafeGuard powder -- she's all better now!!! THANK YOU SO MUCH!!! I"M ALSO USING IT ON ME AND MY 85 yr OLD PARENTS IN A SHAKE. SEARCH ROPE WORMS!!! 4 months cleansing. I PUT TWO PACKET IN ONE ORANGE JULIUS SHAKE/YOGURT AND PROTEIN WHEY FROM INFOWARS --Lisi and Nikita Bear
customer_reviews.author: Lisette Richter

customer_reviews.title: I bought several of these packs to worm my dogs ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought several of these packs to worm my dogs twice accounting for the in between hatching or the eggs to larva stage. The worms awe still present in their stools after two doses .There is no difference from before worming an after wormings. There is still lots of worms present in their stools. This stuff is worthless. I would try another product.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good value, in -date
customer_reviews.text: Currently a better price than Panacur brand. Arrived fast, box itself is annoying to open but packets tear nicely without scissors. Consult your vet for dosing and use as these should only be given based on fecal tests. For typical GI parasites like round/hook/whipworms they are used for 3-5 consecutive days. If using in combination with another drug for giardia, used for 10 consecutive days. Mix with something very yummy as these are bitter and picky dogs may not be willing to consume it no matter what you put it in. For these dogs you may have to request the liquid formulation but this is not ideal for medium to large dogs based on volume required.
customer_reviews.author: J. BushTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Using for treatment of Cancer
customer_reviews.text: I use this for Prostate Cancer high PSA and take one gram for three days and miss the next four days. Several of my friends have had success in bring their PSA down using this regiment.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha L. Odor

customer_reviews.title: Fast and effective!
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm! I noticed that my dog had what looked like tapeworms (like rice stuck under his tail) and his stomach made horrible hunger noises often. I ordered these and started treating him 2 days later. The instructions were very easy. He weighs 100 lbs so medicine typically is expensive for him, but the price of this was VERY affordable. I sprinkled it on his food and he had no problem with the taste. I treated him daily for 3 days and had to scrub the "rice" off of his behind (gross, but what other option is there?) and none came back! His stomach has made no more weird noises either. I'll use this product again every time!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Misleading: Safe-guard 4 Canine Dewormer does not treat the most common type of tapeworm in dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This dewormer treats hookworms, roundworm, and whipworms; however, it only treats one type of tapeworms: taenia pisiformis (this type of tapeworm is more common in cats who eat rodents). The most common type of tapeworm in dogs is Dipylidium. These tapeworms look like grains of rice in the stools. To treat Dipylidum, you need another type of dewormer, such as Sentry HC WormXPlus: Broad Spectrum dewormer. This will treat both types of tapeworms, roundworms and hookworms.
customer_reviews.author: shurt

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Did not kill my dog and got rid of the worms,he had the runs but that's expected of course.i accidentally skipped one day out of the three day course and it still worked. He wasn't I'll acting,he was normal aside from the runs. It comes in the form of powder so you need to mix it in dry food with hot water and my cats for some reason wanted to eat it so beware
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Threw up
customer_reviews.text: I dont want to put a 1 star, and ive read theres only a 1% chance dogs and puppies woll throw up as a side effect. But i guess my pup is that 1% 😭 i weighed her and gave her the exact amount, she ate all her food but within 30 minutes to the rest of the night, she threw up 5 or 6 different times every 10 minutes it seemed like. It was so much! I didnt risk giving it to her the next day. Just upset about it
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dog after I noticed tapeworms in his stool and wanted to avoid a $100 vet visit. He's 80 pounds so I purchased two of these (6 pouches total) and fed him two pouches each day for three days. He ate it mixed into his food no problem, though it was visibly white and chalky. Then again, he's not a very picky eater. We haven't seen any worms in his stool anymore and the upset stomach he was having from the worms has also gone away. I think it's safe to say that this stuff works! Will definitely be buying again should we have this same issue in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I usually use Panacur for giardia treatment but decided to give SafeGuard a try as it contained the same dosage on fendenazole. Worked just as expected and he is not giardia negative. I recommend mixing it in with some wet dog food or canned pumpkin as it is a powder and that way you know they are getting it all. Make sure to get the right dosage. My puppy is 32 pounds so we got the higher 40 pound dosage recommended by the vet
customer_reviews.author: Tyler L.

customer_reviews.title: Treats ALL worms
customer_reviews.text: I needed something that would treat whip worms as well and if you look closely most of the ones that claim to treat everything (7 way, 9 way) don't treat the whip worms. which is one of the more dangerous worms and nearly impossible to completely get rid of if you live in the country as they are in the soil. I will absolutely be sticking with this product not only is it safer as it treats for every kind of worm but it isn't even more expensive. THANK YOU LOVE YOUR PRODUCT!!
customer_reviews.author: Tinklabelle

customer_reviews.title: Worms! 😝
customer_reviews.text: My dog had a really bad case of whipworms! This shut 'em down and promptly evicted the intruders! I read the other reviews about dogs getting sick. i think it may have something to do with dosage. I always divide the daily packet in half and feed half in morning meal and half in evening meal. I will always mix it with a tasty "topper" such as chopped steak or lean hamburger. It adds extra cushion to the tum-tum 😉
customer_reviews.author: 3pups+1kitten+1hub

customer_reviews.title: Safely eliminates hydra in aquariums without harming fish, snails or shrimp
customer_reviews.text: After introducing some new plants to my shrimp tank I woke up one morning to discover one entire wall of my tank covered in hydra! Hydra are deadly to dwarf shrimp so I did some research online and found that fenbendazole is one of the safest methods of eliminating them without harming fish or shrimp. Sure enough, I mixed some up as per the instructions I found online and it only took one dose to kill all the hydra (they were completely gone the next morning) and I didn't lose a single shrimp or snail. Excellent price to save an entire tank of shrimp!
customer_reviews.author: Pegasene

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: After deep consultation of the package directions (photo provided in the product descrption) I was able to choose the correct number of packages for my 80 lb. dog. Administering the product was simple and I guess it tastes okay as my finicky dog ate it up quickly. The price was right and instructions easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Rtsquirrel

customer_reviews.title: Dosage is deceptive, you will probably need more than one package.
customer_reviews.text: Even though there are pictures showing the exact dosages, this product is very deceptive. You don’t really understand those pictures until you actually open the package and realize, each of the dosage colors of 1g, or 2g, or 4g is actually a different package that you must buy. Unless your dog is at the very lowest weight for that product, you’ll have to buy more than one package to complete the three days of dosing. Yes, all the information is there but it doesn’t really make sense until you have it in hand.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: I had some hesitancy about ordering dog medication through Amazon and not through my Vet, but with Amazon's shipping options I was able to get this product sooner than I could get a vet appointment. My dog (who is a pretty picky eater) didn't mind having this on her food at all, and after the recommended dosage she wasn't completely worm free. This product worked great, and was an extremely affordable option. I noticed results in just a few days.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I think it works, however...
customer_reviews.text: It did make my dog vomit. I ended up giving the dewormer for four days as she vomited the first day, and then she really wanted to eat grass to help settle her stomach. The easiest way to administer is to mix in with some wet dog food before serving. I gave this as a preventative so I will assume it worked, as she went to the vet yesterday and tested negative for worms. Just keep a close eye on your dogs after giving to make sure they do not have adverse reactions, like vomiting or worse.
customer_reviews.author: Ausome Goods Co.

customer_reviews.title: Great to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: We camp a lot with our dogs. This is great to have on hand. So many new places to explore and this comes in handy when the very first symptoms of parasitic worm infestation. If this does not cure the symptoms after the 3 days of treatment then a visit to the vet is the next step. Most of the time this does cure the dog.
customer_reviews.author: 2 QUILT 4 U

customer_reviews.title: 1 box does not treat large dogs
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, this box of wormer for LARGE DOGS, does not contain enough of the medication to treat any dog over 40 lbs for the recommended 3days of treatment. Misleading and I feel this to be on purpose. Whether it works or not, not giving this company any more of my money.
customer_reviews.author: CThib

customer_reviews.title: like price and effectiveness
customer_reviews.text: I can't cut my dog open to see if the whip worms are gone but he seems more comfortable and no more accidents on the floor. The vet wanted me to put him on trifexis which was to be expensive so I went this route and he has been good, make sure to dose again 3mos after the first round to ensure egg hatch kill.
customer_reviews.author: a** clown

customer_reviews.title: Effective, the 40lb treatment worked on my 55lb dog.
customer_reviews.text: My dog weighs 55 lbs, and I used the 40 lb pouches, and they still worked. I just mixed the powder into his canned food, did the complete regimen as directed and the worms were gone. No extra product was needed to make up for his extra weight.
customer_reviews.author: Spicahontas

customer_reviews.title: Works great! great price!
customer_reviews.text: My puppy had worms when we got her, I immediately went to WalMart and got dewormer, about two weeks later I saw worms again and went to WalMart and got more dewormer and treated her again. About two weeks later I noticed worms again, so instead of going to WalMart I ordered this product from Amazon and she never had worms again. That was a frustrating time.
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: Dewormer
customer_reviews.text: I wish the dosage info was more complete in the ads or I would have known to get two boxes for my 80# German shepherd. (I supplemented with a box from my local store). The brand works fine, but be aware the dose depends on your dog's size so you may need more than one box.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Dog is worm free
customer_reviews.text: We noticed our dog (42 lbs) had worms so we purchased this next day and got within the 2 days. We did just as instructed and used one packet each day for 3 days and noticed our dog was worm free after. Very cheap compared to store brands and works just as fast. Would highly recommend this for someone who needs to deworm without breaking the bank or seeing a vet to prescribe expensive meds.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Had to use multiple times and still failed
customer_reviews.text: I have treated my dogs on a few occasions with this even did a double treatment it did not work well on my dogs. They still had worms really bad. After about 4/5 tries and followed directions I gave up went to local vet because this did not work on my two bulldogs. I would not recommend if dog is infested.
customer_reviews.author: kdb

customer_reviews.title: easy and effective
customer_reviews.text: This review is for Safe Guard Canine Dewormer for Large Dog dogs. I like this product because it works for a veriety of worms where as many other brands are only a 4 in one or less. It's easy to administer, comes in a individual packet of a granulated powder that can easily be mixed into wet dog food and they all scarf it down, even my pickiest of eaters eats it with out hesitation. Tip: I purchased a large box even for my small dogs and used the weight chart in the back to dose my smaller dogs two dogs with one box saves money!!!! Yes I would recomend this product to friends and family
customer_reviews.author: Mamaa4444

customer_reviews.title: Dog didn’t like the taste
customer_reviews.text: I tried mixing this in with my dog’s food. She refused to eat for a day and a half. I then tried to add peanut butter because that’s the only thing that works with getting her to take her medicine. It didn’t work. Unfortunately, I had to pour it straight into her mouth. I’m so glad it worked because I felt horrible. After 3 days the worms were gone.
customer_reviews.author: Dkb

customer_reviews.title: Fantasic
customer_reviews.text: I suspected that my dog had whipworms based on her symptoms, but the vet couldn't confirm it. Apparently they are difficult to diagnose from a fecal exam. After a failed round of antibiotics and probiotics from the vet to treat what they thought was a bacterial infection, I went ahead and bought this myself. I gave her two rounds of treatments, two weeks apart, and her symptoms have completely resolved! I'll start deworming on a regular basis now, just to be sure she doesn't have to go through that again!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: It works! the worms are gone. I mixed this with a little chicken broth in my dog's food and he ate it all.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Angus Fannypants

customer_reviews.title: Very effective and has a longer term effect
customer_reviews.text: I recently notice a roundworm in my dog’s stool. I bought and used this product and it did a great job of clearing up the problem. My dog had no problem with the flavor and it had no residual effects her stool consistency. I like that it continues to work for up to 6 months. I would definitely use this again.
customer_reviews.author: linda crawford kober

customer_reviews.title: Better Advertising
customer_reviews.text: Have a picture of a 80lb dog on the box and its not even enough to treat that animal. I needed 3 boxes, maybe make a product that actually has a one box treatment for a large dog. I know you won't make as much money, a full treatment with another company is half the price of 3 boxes of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great value, works well.
customer_reviews.text: My husky gets into all kinds of trash outside. She also loves dead animals, which is a problem when she runs in the woods. She used to have worms when we just adopted her, but now I give her these meds once a year, and she is fine. No worms so far! Great value, too, as you don't have to see a vet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Def worth the price compared to VET BILL
customer_reviews.text: This product work just as effective as the $75 are vet charges for something of the similar product I will be ordering this product at least once to twice a week to keep my dogs on a regiment and sure these little suckers do not come back
customer_reviews.author: 84tigersfan

customer_reviews.title: Same active ingredient we received from our vet - the difference was price.
customer_reviews.text: This product contains the same active ingredient as Panacur which we were given by the vet a few years ago. The instructions are the same as for Panacur. Feed the appropriate amount to your dog for three days in a row. Since we feed our dogs dry food, I scrambled two eggs, waited for them to cool, and powdered the eggs generously with dewormer. Roscoe gobbled it up without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: JNLA

customer_reviews.title: Worms were gone after treament
customer_reviews.text: I'm assuming this worked on my 85lb. Lab. He had some kind of flatworm(alive inside/on the poop). two orders were needed so I could do two envelopes a day for 3 days. They came and went before I gave him the treatment, but were gone completely after. Saved $ vs going to the vet for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Dog-approved
customer_reviews.text: I give the product 3 stars because we are in series for a puppy, but I wanted to comment on the flavor. My puppy loves it! The dosing is more difficult when your dog requires a partial packet. You may need to order extra boxes when dosing pups who will be gaining weight between doses.
customer_reviews.author: Hey Lady!

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. My pitbull is worm free now. I took my dog to the vet to get his feces checked and it came out negative. Save yourself some money by getting this. Instead of going to the vet to charge you expensive check up fee just to look and tell you what you already know. Then charge you for the product they prescribe to you.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I fed my puppy the recommended dose and the tapeworms passed through her stool in 3 days. Her energy was lower than usual during the three days and she vomited on the first day but.....no more tapeworms and her energy level is back to normal. I feel like if I don't slow her down somedays she'll jump out the damn window. God, I love her:-)
customer_reviews.author: Kim G.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't have to disguise
customer_reviews.text: I have an older dog and have tried everything from pills to liquid wormers. This was by far one of the best. Just added to the dog food and it was done. Never had to mix broth or raw hamburger or hid the a pill a hot to get her to take it. No fussing. It covers all worms not just round like the liquid form I paid high dollar for. It never made her sick or slow her down like past wormers. In fact she was spunkier.
customer_reviews.author: renae neil

customer_reviews.title: Take your dog to the vet!
customer_reviews.text: My dog only pooped out 2 worms.. the whole treatment. Took him to the vet got a shot and he pooped out so many worms in just the first hour!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.C

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: I noticed my dog had worms in his stool so i decided to buy him something low cost but effective. You gotta get creative with this stuff because dogs will not easily eat it if you simply sprinkle it on their food bowl. what I did was use pork meat and bacon grease to hide the smell. and it did a great job I ordered 2 boxes just in case and gave him the medicine 3 days in a row, stop for 2 days and again 3 days in a row. later that week he no longer had worms in his stool and i was happy with the results.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Save Money and Divide It
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to brand to worm my dogs, but I save money by buying the package for larger dogs and carefully dividing it up for my smaller dogs. One package split a few ways for the same price as one dose makes more sense to me.
customer_reviews.author: jennigirl

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why they ask me how the flavor is
customer_reviews.text: So, I tested them. I suddenly have the urge to bark at neighborhood cats and kids, I peed on the floor twice, and think that I'm not going to the zoo tomorrow, I'm really getting neutered.. Will report back any other adverse effects
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: Not enough!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 90 lb golden lab who has tapeworm. Eww. This product was easy to administer, but doesn't come with enough to treat my dog. The instructions are to admisister one packet for each 40 lbs of dog once daily for three days. So my 80 lb lab needs twice as much medicine than what I recieved. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Great worm medicine!
customer_reviews.text: I have my vet tech degree so I know what products I can get away with ordering without going to see a vet. This worked really well for our dogs’ roundworms. I just add the powder to some cottage cheese and within the first dose, they were gone! Definitely recommend to avoid costly vet fees (ONLY if you are knowledgeable enough to be able to identify worms and how to treat!!)
customer_reviews.author: Davids Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Gave my Pup the recommend amount over the course of a few days. NOTE i do recommend doing this if you plan on being home because the stool is gonna be watery. Learned that the hard way.LOL. Worms appeared in stool a day later and she is now worm free! Works great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As with most over the counter pet wormers...
customer_reviews.text: It simply doesn't work. Wasted money on 3 doses. Then finally a vet. Where i should've gone initially. These never have worked for me. I have no idea why 8 continue to try otc wormers
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca N

customer_reviews.title: People said their dog didn't like the powder on its food
customer_reviews.text: This thing came with 3 packs and based on my dogs size he got 1 pack daily. He pooped dead worms on the second , third, and forth day (today). I'm assuming since they are dead this thing is working. No diarrhea or vomiting. People said their dog didn't like the powder on its food. My dog didn't give a hoot. Didn't even miss a beat eating it. He wasnt sick or anything to begin with still seem fine. Will follow up review of anything changes but so far seem to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Shonage

customer_reviews.title: Great product...it works
customer_reviews.text: My dog has responded well to the treatments. He is retriever .chow mix and he is very active . The 1st treatment he crapped that mess from his system. My sister told me about the product because her big dog has been taking it for a while with great results. Big and healthy. Really saved me a ton of $$$ for vet visits.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are fine ...but
customer_reviews.text: Its dog dewormer - it works I ended up using these for my large breed dogs - but it was getting expensive... This is the safely packaged version for dogs - and owners who don't want to do a ton of research to know how to deworm their dogs. Ended up on round 2 using the goat dewormer (same exact product - different label) to do the same exact thing .... which was 1/4 the price of these. Just make sure you have the dosage for dogs right since it is different than the dosage for goats. Its off label usage but it worked fine...
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M

customer_reviews.title: Easy and effective.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always enjoyed using this product. Gets a wide spectrum of worms and over the years I’ve never had a dog refuse to eat it. Usually I’ll just put it on some canned food and they don’t even notice.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Dove

customer_reviews.title: Worked on my Lab by the 2nd day
customer_reviews.text: Tried another product from amazon but didn't work so I gave this a try. My lab is 80 lbs so I was under prescribing her the medication, by the second day she was worm free. Gave her the 3rd dose just to make sure and is worm free till this day. Great product and will order again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Bobdahurricane

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: The directions on the back of the box contradict what the front of the box says. When I called to ask customer services to clarify the discrepancy the individual on the phone was beyond rude. He was upset with me for simply asking him to help me inderstand which directions to follow. I won’t be buying this product ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Tom MacCrae

customer_reviews.title: Easy to administer
customer_reviews.text: Easy to administer to the pets, powder goes easy on any food (best on soft dog food).
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette

customer_reviews.title: Bad Reactions !!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions BUT this caused severe problems, her eyes got very red & sore, the same around her mouth. She now constantly scouts her but inside & outside, she’s almost 8 years old and NEVER did this before ever!! From now on she gets treated at her local vets office.
customer_reviews.author: Great Bargains

customer_reviews.title: OUTSTANDING ITEM
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting this product to be dull like others I’ve tried especially since it was only a 3 day supply and my Pups has a very severe case of worms but it proved me wrong today is day 2 of my using it and I’m already seeing an great improvement
customer_reviews.author: Yolanda Grant

customer_reviews.title: Do not use!!!
customer_reviews.text: Apparently dogs frequently have horrible allergic reactions to the enzyme released by dead worms. The product does its job, but my dog suffered miserably for five days. Use the stuff that paralyzes the worms... you’ll have to give a second dose, but it’s so much easier on the pupper.
customer_reviews.author: matt costa

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: So far my dog has been worm free since I noticed some in her stools. I also dewormed my other dogs as a precaution and everyone seems happy to eat it and no one has had any discomfort from needing to potty more often.
customer_reviews.author: Elena Elwart

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: We have free-range chickens and my Aussies love the little treats that they leave behind 😬 We had a vet visit two weeks after using this product and both of my dogs were clean of parasites. I mixed this with some raw ground beef so they wouldn't notice.
customer_reviews.author: Katlynn Walker

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Our yard is visited by several animals at night that carry worms (raccoons, foxes, possum, deer) and so our dog has gotten worms more than once. This product is great, effective and works fast to give our dog some much needed relief. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decrease in worms for about a month
customer_reviews.text: My indoor dog had tapeworms so I tried this. It's unclear if I need multiple Rounds of treatment but after a month they are back. My dog didn't object to eating food with this over it and she didn't get ill from the treatment. I did see a decrease in worms but I am looking for another treatment since they returned so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: T Stanley

customer_reviews.title: This works great!  Saves a trip to the vet!
customer_reviews.text: My large lab mix had small white worms of some sort, and I decided to try this before we made an expensive trip to the vet. This worked PERFECTLY. It didn't make her a bit sick and the worms were gone the next day and never came back!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Always my go-to dewormer for my dogs as it kills 4 types of worms and most otc brands only kill 3 types. It's a pain to measure out for my smaller dogs but we manage. I mix with their wetfood really well and they don't seem to taste it.
customer_reviews.author: BrandyFL79

customer_reviews.title: Messy but it works
customer_reviews.text: This wormer really can't be mixed with dry food. Since that's all we feed our dogs this was actually a plus...I mixed it with wet food and my dogs thought they were getting a treat! It's messy (doesn't mix in completely) and requires three days of dosing but it did work really well. No more evidence of worms in their poops and no more embarrassing scooching their rear ends on the ground when company comes! Will definitely purchase again when the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dog Worming Medicine
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my dog and had to mix it in with something really tasty, as I'm pretty sure he was wondering what I was trying to force on him now. I actually tasted it, and it left after taste. Idk what dogs think about that.
customer_reviews.author: Madm007

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as Panacur C
customer_reviews.text: I got this when Panacur was unavailable as they are supposed to be the same ingredient. But these packets did not work as well for my dogs who are rescues battling chronic parasite issues :(
customer_reviews.author: Uturn

customer_reviews.title: Buy more than you need.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Needed 4 tabs per dog for 100+ lbs dogs
customer_reviews.author: dboo2050

customer_reviews.title: Great product, dosage can be kinda tricky
customer_reviews.text: Very effective, especially for the price. The only problem is if your pet's weight requires an amount that is not pre weighted out in the bags, you have to eyeball the dosage. It's not too hard but it would be better if it came in 1 gram bags.
customer_reviews.author: Jahejema

customer_reviews.title: I bought this and administered to my 60lbs German Rotti ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and administered to my 60lbs German Rotti puppy. I gave her 6 grams three days straight as suggested and she is still passing live worms....they've even gotten larger. I only didn't give one star because I can't be certain now that the type of worm she has is the one type this medication doesn't treat. I now have to take her to the vet and spend a heap of money that I'd hoped this would help me prevent form spending. smh..win some lose some. If this post is still listed throughout 2018 that means that she didn't have that type of worm and that this medicine should have prevented the infestation of parasites she's fighting.
customer_reviews.author: Alex W.

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works as it should. We gave it to our dog to kill worms and now give it to him every 6 months to prevent worms. Our vet approved it. Just pour powered on dogs food and he eats it right up.
customer_reviews.author: Wasame

customer_reviews.title: Buy 2 packages for BIG dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Well, the product worked so I'm being fair in my review and giving it three stars. It could have been my fault but I did not see the instructions until AFTER that advised to buy 2 packages for big dogs. I have a 75lb dog. I would have been very disappointed if I would have had to buy more. Fortunately the one package did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Steffie

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Great value easy to use it did make both of my dogs vomit I did use the right amount but after I gave it to them I could hear their stomach making rumbling sounds. My dogs are over 100lb I only gave them one package each I cancelled it and will try one more time if still they feel bad I will just try something else😬
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Lares

customer_reviews.title: it got rid of the worms
customer_reviews.text: my puppy came from the breeder who said she had just been wormed. Several days later it was obvious that she still had worms. I used this product as directed and for now I see no evidence of worms, I will worm her again as directed.
customer_reviews.author: neidt

customer_reviews.title: Worked fast. Worked well.
customer_reviews.text: Not much else to say, besides worked fast, worked well. Only needed to use once to take care of the problem. Not too expensive, for it's purpose. Will buy again, if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy S

customer_reviews.title: Not for large dogs
customer_reviews.text: It said for large dogs. My dog is 54 lbs. According to the package, it should have at least 6 more ounces in the package. My dog isn't that large, this box should have been for small to medium size dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Dom

customer_reviews.title: Makes your dog sick
customer_reviews.text: My dog broke out in hives after 1 dose took him to the vet next day and paid $130 that i cant afford. My dog is miserable
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: the best dewormer on the market
customer_reviews.text: This is, in my opinion, the best dewormer on the market. Based on what I have read, I believe this product eliminates a wider range of parasites than any other single product on the market; is virtually non-toxic; and is flavorless, so there is no problem in getting your pet to ingest it. It mixes easily with food. Although not "approved" in the U.S. for cats, I have read that it is used for cats as well as dogs across Europe, and is administered with the same dosage per unit weight as with dogs. However, I am not a vet, so discuss its use with your vet before giving to your cat or other animals.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy W. Maich

customer_reviews.title: Feeling happy after taking safe guard!
customer_reviews.text: Product seemed to have worked according to the info with this product. Its really hard to tell as of now. Willie our 8 yr old german shepherd took it with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Yuk
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even know that they made dog dewormer in powder form. Would it be that hard to put it into a chewable? My dog won't eat this. Dog's are pretty intelligent creatures and know when some unknown powder has been sprinkled on their food.
customer_reviews.author: JR Foundation

customer_reviews.title: Do not but powder get pills
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend it. I had to order the chewable.
customer_reviews.author: Robin L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Switched
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive and the dogs won't eat it. Switched to safeguard goat dewormer, give it in a needless syringe- bingo Bangor, done!
customer_reviews.author: sindy beard

customer_reviews.title: Dog ate it
customer_reviews.text: With peanut butter, he inhaled it. Wish they had a two day one instead of three and took a lot of packets for my dog but glad they list per pound. Instructions were confusing
customer_reviews.author: Lilliana Colancecco

customer_reviews.title: Dog liked it
customer_reviews.text: We mixed each packet in a peanutbutter sandwich. She ate it and didn't have an issue eating it. She even licked some of the few powder crumbs that fell on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: LovelyLil

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't worth my money
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to use and our dog didn't reject it at all but it was supposed to take care of worms with the 3 day dosage. It didn't. 3 weeks later, we bought some liquid dewormer(for the same type of worms) and they are gone.
customer_reviews.author: Cherilyn Keener

customer_reviews.title: Won't Buy Again
customer_reviews.text: This was hard to mix into anything, and the taste was obvious to my dog. Oh, and it didn't work. So we still had to make the expensive trip to the vet to get better treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Clevenger

customer_reviews.title: Great for treating parasite for half the cost
customer_reviews.text: How can you rate this lower than a 5 star when you buy the same product from the Vet's office at double the price? Don't let them fool you because this product contains the same active ingredients your vet gives you for getting rid of pesky parasites. I own a German Shepherd that goes to doggy daycare for socialization. Unfortunately when you put a dog into an area with concentration of other dogs your chance of picking up bugs increase dramatically. My dog came down with giardia and we brought it to the vet. They prescribed pancur which is fenbendazole same as this from Safeguard. However my vet charges a ridiculous amount for a 5 day treatment.
customer_reviews.author: SamofBoston

customer_reviews.title: Just go to the vet
customer_reviews.text: The product probably worked once upon a time. But this failed to rid my pup of her worms. Just go to the vet guys they have the good stuff that works the best.
customer_reviews.author: Heron Navarro

customer_reviews.title: Useful pet medication
customer_reviews.text: Same ingredient as the prescription you get from the vet. Also used to treat Giardia. (Not same dosing as what it on the package however.)
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Dog Medicine
customer_reviews.text: I put this in my dogs food as prescribed and he ate it. In a week, my dog stop dragging his butt on the concrete and grass making his butt red.
customer_reviews.author: Colin E. Peters

product_meta.title: Excel Products
product_meta.description: Size:Large Dogs | 40 lbs/pouchPro-Sense brand offers a variety of proactive, sensible solutions for all of your pet’s healthcare and wellness needs. Pro-Sense knows that pet parenting can be tough so they have improved ingredients and overall benefits to make it easier than ever to care for them. Pro-Sense 3 Day Treatment Dewormer Solutions treats and controls 4 common types of worms. Packaged in 3, 4 gram dosages the Dewormer Solutions treat Tapeworms (Taenia pisiformis), Roundworms (Toxocara canis, Toxascaris leonina), Hookworms (Ancyclostoma caninum, Uncinaria stenocephala), Whipworms (Trichuris vulpis). It is recommended that weaned pups, meaning those 6-8 weeks old, should be dewormed at approximately 6, 8, 10 and 12 weeks of age while dogs 6 months of age and over should be dewormed at least twice each year. Daily dosages will vary so it is important to weigh your dog to make sure the correct dosage is administered. After weighing follow the guide on the back of the packaging to ensure treatment and control of worms.
feature_bullets: Safe Guard treats against Tapeworms, Roundworms, Hookworms, and Whipworms
Easy to feed granules that mix into food
Safe for young puppies over the age of 6 weeks, pregnant dogs, and heartworm infected dogs
Must be administered for 3 consecutive days and is effective for 6 months
Each package contains three 4-gram pouches, each pouch treats 40 pounds

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
